Although it may not be feasible to restore the orchards since locals have repurposed them as farmlands, planting low-irrigation plants along roads and vacant government land offers the path of least resistance for enhancing the green cover.
 
 
 
 We plan to carry out this project in partnership with a local agriculture college affiliated with a leading Agricultural University in Bihar. The college authorities have already pledged their support in identifying both farm and non-farm plants that are suitable for the specific soil, require low water, and minimally impact the ecosystem.
 
 
 
 # 4Ô∏è‚É£ Part 4 - Rejuvenation of Kao (Kav) and Thora Rivers üèûÔ∏è
 
 
 
 **Key aspects:**
 
 
 
 * Rejuvenate the river systems, contributing to groundwater recharging and providing arsenic-free potable water
 
 * Revive ancient forest cover, attracting higher precipitation
 
 * Overcome challenges like encroachment identification, clearing, and desiltation/dredging through government programs and local government coordination
 
 
 
 **Useful Links:**
 
 
 
 http://wikimapia.org/river/16196359/Kao-River
 
 https://www.prabhatkhabar.com/state/bihar/nalanda/231143
 
 https://www.livehindustan.com/bihar/buxar/story-garbage-dumping-yard-has-become-the-bank-of-kava-river-in-dumraon-3457926.html
 
 
 
 As our most ambitious part of the project idea, this initiative has the potential to drastically enhance groundwater recharge in the neighboring agricultural belt and ensure arsenic-free drinking water for a significant portion of at least three districts in Bihar: Rohtas, Bhojpur, and Buxar.
 
 
 
 The project focuses on the rejuvenation of the Kao and Thora rivers. The Kao river originates from a 130-foot high perennial waterfall called DHUAN, named after the smokescreen-like appearance created by water droplets bouncing up to 60 feet. The waterfall sources its water from the Kaimoor Plateau, making the Kao river perennial as well. The river meanders through rocky obstructions before reaching the plain after a journey of less than a kilometer. Approximately 30 km downstream, it converges with the Thora river. Initially sourced from an artisan well, the Thora river faced blockage due to human interference. However, the source resurfaced downstream, and the river continues to flow, providing pollutant-free water from its subsurface stream.
 
 
 
 Kao and Thora rivers merge and proceed toward the Ganga (Ganges) river. After about 60 km of combined flow, they fall into Kokila Taal and ultimately meet the Ganga through Kokila Taal. These rivers were vibrant water systems until encroachment and siltation began to clog them a couple of decades ago, resulting in their current impending extinction.
 
 
 
 Reviving these river systems will contribute to the restoration of an ancient, large forest cover, attracting above-average precipitation in the area. Rejuvenation efforts face numerous challenges, such as identifying encroachments through drone mapping, clearing encroachments (including riverbeds), and securing manpower through government programs like MNREGA for desilting and dredging the riverbeds. This process will necessitate close coordination with local government officials, potentially involving the judicial system. Consequently, this uphill journey will require substantial financial support and seamless collaboration.
 
 
 
 -------------------------------------------------------
 
 # **üéØ Project's Target Population and Geographical Area -**
 
 
 
 The project will have a direct impact on the ~150,000 inhabitants of the Buxar district in Bihar, India. üáÆüá≥üë©‚Äçüåæüë®‚Äçüåæ
 
 
 
 We also intend to create a replicable model which can be open-sourced so that it can be used by any farmer across India.
 
 
 
 -------------------------------------------------------
 
 # **üìÜ Proposed Project Timeline, Total Budget and Breakdown of Expenses üí∞ -**
 
 
 
 It has already been mentioned that the various parts of the project ideas can be implemented simultaneously, though the time frame for reaching each part to a level of self-sustenance may differ for each. The seeds of the project ideas were sown about a year ago. This involved traveling, informal meetings, and data collection. Though no formal record has been maintained, the preparation has involved an expenditure of about $6,000 out of personal resources.
 
 
 
 The projection of the time frame and financial outlay is discussed part-wise below:
 
 
 
 # 1Ô∏è‚É£ Part 1 - ‚ÄúIntroduction of Regenerative agriculture to the local ecosystem‚Äù üåæ
 
 As previously mentioned, the innovative agricultural approach will complete its first cycle within a year, allowing the demonstration of success in at least two seasonal crops for further expansion by ourselves and others. Throughout this period, public relations efforts will be maintained by organizing site visits and hosting audiovisual seminars.
 
 
 
 Time frame: 1 year
 
 Cumulative expenditure: $25,000
 
 
 
 The true challenge lies in promoting the concept and consolidating fragmented land holdings into functional units via cooperative structures. Addressing numerous legal issues and establishing the credibility and sincerity of our intentions through prolonged and in-depth engagement with potential collaborators will require both time and significant financial investment.
 
 
 
 Time frame: 3 years
 
 Cumulative expenditure: $40,000
 
 
 
 # 2Ô∏è‚É£ Part 2 - ‚ÄúRevival of the local water bodies and use of Solar Power in irrigation‚Äù üíß‚òÄÔ∏è
 
 
 
 The results of efforts in this phase will become evident within two years, assuming normal rainfall. This process will also require labor costs for excavating blocked water bodies to sufficient depths, creating rainwater channels and embankments, installing deep tube wells, and acquiring solar pumps and panels. While substantial government support is anticipated, it is wise to establish a reserve fund to guarantee smooth and uninterrupted execution.
 
 
 
 Time frame: 2 years
 
 Capital expenditure: $60,000
 
 
 
 # 3Ô∏è‚É£ Part 3 - ‚ÄúRevival of local Forest cover‚Äù üå≥
 
 
 
 Reviving the green cover is a lengthy process that will necessitate significant involvement in legal proceedings. While the government and local Agriculture College may assist with tree planting, our organization will need to handle the judicial aspects. Given the extensive encroachment on land that was once forested, it could take approximately five years to restore the area to its original state.
 
 
 
 Time frame: 5 years
 
 Pre-operative and capital expenditure: $60,000
 
 
 
 # 4Ô∏è‚É£ Part 4 - ‚ÄúRejuvenation of Kao (Kav) and Thora rivers‚Äù üåä
 
 
 
 As previously stated, this is our most ambitious project idea, and understandably, it will have the longest implementation timeframe ‚Äì at least five years. The process requires a comprehensive and detailed assessment of the river basin's degradation extent. Drone technology must be employed to obtain real-time data. Rectifying the situation cannot rely solely on voluntary participation from the people involved, necessitating a challenging and costly legal process. Restoring channels, constructing embankments, and dredging the basin are all demanding and expensive tasks.
 
 
 
 Time frame: At least 5 years
 
 Fund reserve: $200,000
 
 
 
 **To summarize, the overall time frame required for the project is about 5 years, with an aggregate fund requirement of ~$400,000**. Apart from raising grants from Gitcoin and other web3 and web2 organizations, we will also explore funding options like carbon credits forward markets and tap into various government initiatives to support projects like ours. üöÄüí°
 
 
 
 -------------------------------------------------------
 
 # **ü§ù Collaborations involved in the Project üåü -**
 
 
 
 * The dean of the local, state-affiliated agricultural university has pledged support of any every kind possible, including helping us liaison with the state government to fast-track all the necessary approvals. üéì
 
 
 
 * Priyank Bakshi from MRV Foundation, a Gitcoin grantee, is helping us understanding the web3 and ReFi ecosystem so that we can leverage these concepts for achieving our project goals üå±ü§ñ
 
 
 
 -------------------------------------------------------
 
 # **üåü Team üåü -**
 
 
 
 ## üöÄ Executive Team
 
 We are a group of environmentalists, engineers, financial experts, and social workers. Though we are located presently at different places, we have a permanent establishment in a prominent and strategically located village in Buxar District. We propose to distribute responsibilities according to capability and availability. The founding team will be permanently located at the village for coordination.
 
 
 
 1. **Mr. B. V. Sinha -** He is a senior ex-banker with about three decades' experience in project formulation, overseeing implementation through Management Information System and physical inspection, and enforcing financial discipline. Currently, he is a member of the Board of Directors of two Companies actively engaged in correcting the financial structure and upgrading technology of the corporates facing distress. He has been working on Navonmesh for over a couple of years; collecting data, making physical surveys, and taking on board academicians and functionaries conversant with the environment and capable of bringing about beneficial but legal modification in the regulatory structure. He was born, brought up, and had initial education in the village and is extensively familiar with the place and persons.
 
 
 
 2. **Dr. Divya Sinha -** She is the wife of Mr. B. V. Sinha and has conducted extensive research in Environmental Geomorphology. She has been an academician and teacher throughout her career and has a passion for keen analysis of the issues involving both human and physical capital. She will be immensely useful in selecting competent human resources for project implementation and keeping them motivated by constant guidance and encouragement.
 
 
 
 3. **Mr. Kshitij Mohan -** He has retired as the Chief General Manager of a leading energy-focused Public Sector Undertaking of India. A Mechanical Engineer by degree and profession, his forte was management of the corporation for optimal and uninterrupted operation. He has a keen interest in the potential of alternate sources of electricity. He is expected to contribute significantly to reducing dependence on irrigation of cultivable land on conventional sources of electricity and contribute thereby in the reduction in demand and need for production of the same.
 
 
 
 ## üåê Advisory Team
 
 
 
 1. **Mrs. Mala Mohini** - She currently serves as the C.O.O. of Enviroway Bioscience Pvt Ltd., a pioneer in advanced bioengineering, providing eco-friendly solutions for water and wastewater management. With a rich experience spanning fifteen years in environmental science, specifically a decade dedicated to wastewater treatment and reuse, Mrs. Mohini has profoundly impacted the sector. Hailing from Patna, she has consistently championed water conservation. While she holds an MBA in Business Administration and a degree in Physics, her passion for sustainable water use led her to establish Enviroway Bioscience. Starting as a modest consultancy, under her leadership, the firm expanded its services to offer chemical, biological, and engineering support, meeting the stringent pollution norms set by PCB. 
 
 
 
 
 
 2. **Mrs. Surya Chandra** - A dynamic HR professional, she holds an MBA from the Indian School of Mines, Dhanbad. Additionally, her entrepreneurial flair is sharpened by a course at IIM Bangalore's NERCEL. Over the years, Surya has developed a nuanced understanding of employee engagement, managing teams, and honing talent across various sectors. What truly stands out is her role at Royal Gen, where she merged the spheres of business and environmental consciousness by advocating toy sharing, encouraging sustainable practices, and promoting conservation values among children. Her international exposure at HSBC Global Resourcing saw her transitioning a major project from Edinburgh to an offshore location, emphasizing her adaptability and global understanding. Her inherent ability to rally teams and her commitment to environmental consciousness make her an invaluable asset to our initiative.
 
 
 
 -------------------------------------------------------
 
 # **Update on the funds received during Gitcoin Beta Round Funds -**
 
 
 
 We recieved a total funding of $350 in ETH and DAI, all of which went into travel expenses incurred for holding partnership meetings and site visits.

Title: River Cleanup
Description:
# River Cleanup
 
 
 
 TL/DR: 
 
 
 
 * **200.000+ volunteers**
 
 * **Active in 96 countries** 
 
 * **Collected +3.4 million kilograms of River Waste**
 
 * **Organized 4647 decentralized cleanups**
 
 
 
 
 
 ## üåä Our vision: plastic-free rivers!
 
 
 
 Since 2019, we have built a community of more than 200.000 volunteers, organized 4500+ events, and are active in 96 countries along 161 rivers. As a result, we permanently removed 3.4 million kg of waste from the environment, including 2.000.000+ kilograms of plastics.
 
 
 
 [![river-cleanup-indonesia.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/htXHJSDN/river-cleanup-indonesia.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/68NHgxGh)
 
 *--Indonesia--*
 
 
 
 *Vision statement explained*
 
 
 
 When formulating our vision statement in 2021, we extensively discussed our desired vision for the future. What did we want to achieve ultimately? The answer was obvious: plastics have no place in our rivers, so rivers should be 100% free of macro and microplastics.
 
 While that's certainly ambitious, the alternative of not even trying to make rivers plastic-free didn't and still doesn't feel right. The costs for present and future generations of plastic pollution are simply too devastating.
 
 
 
 At one point, going to the moon was also considered impossible, yet people went. Ambition does not blind our sense of realism, though. Making rivers plastic-free is a step-by-step process. It may not be achievable for all rivers in the world, but every piece of plastic we collect is removed forever. So, every km of river cleaned is a step in the right direction. And in the end, we may have to accept that some pollution is too difficult or costly to remove, but at least it's a well-thought-through decision and not merely a lack of effort.
 
 
 
 ## Our solution: The Ripple Model 
 
 
 
 The Ripple Model is an open-source, ready-to-use, hands-on Theory of Change (ToC) by River Cleanup to make rivers plastic-free. How it works and what role we play are outlined in this summary. 
 
 
 
 [![RC-Theory-of-Change-10-Nov-2022-horizontal.png](https://i.postimg.cc/05MCTbN6/RC-Theory-of-Change-10-Nov-2022-horizontal.png)](https://postimg.cc/jCTNNqPK)
 
 
 
 ## Mission 
 
 River Cleanup is a global network organization stopping plastics from reaching our oceans by cleaning rivers, changing behavior, and transforming organizations.
 
 
 
 [![before-after-cleanup.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/xdrFcMFb/before-after-cleanup.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/pmZBShv2)
 
 *--Ishem River, Albania--*
 
 
 
 *Mission statement explained*
 
 
 
 River Cleanup aspires to be a global network. The notion of being a network organization is driven by the belief that we need more cooperation. No single entity can solve the problem alone; our strength is connecting people. 'Operational' network emphasizes the fact that we are action-driven and impact-focused. We plan to integrate more web3 tooling as our organization continues evolving in this fast moving space.
 
 
 
 ## Values
 
 1. Professional | 2. Inclusive | 3. Positive | 4. Ethical | 5. Impact-driven
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 ## Priorities 
 
 In addition to prioritizing holistic solutions to make rivers plastic-free, we also defined additional general priorities to direct our precious time and resources:
 
 
 
 ‚óè Top 1000 most polluted rivers 
 
 
 
 In practice, we can and will support efforts to make other rivers plastic-free as well, but this is less of a priority because we have more impact focusing on these 1.000 rivers that account for 80% of the ocean plastic leakage.
 
 
 
 ‚óè Macroplastics 
 
 We focus our limited resources first and foremost on macroplastic pollution because of the following reasons: 
 
 ‚Ä¢ Impact: by reducing macroplastic pollution, we stop new microplastic pollution
 
 ‚Ä¢ Efficiency: a single plastic can disintegrate into 10.000+ microplastics
 
 ‚Ä¢ Experience: we do not yet have extensive experience with microplastics
 
 
 
 ## Workflow
 
 
 
 The following workflow is integrated into the Theory of Change to enhance its practical use even further. 
 
 
 
 **1. Assessment**
 
 Everything starts with a holistic assessment of the pollution problem in and around the river (section). Points of attention include the type of pollution, environmental, socio-economic, and cultural (root) causes, volume, etc., as well as the feasibility of potential solutions in each of the three pillars: clean, educate, and transform. 
 
 
 
 **2. Planning & Funding**
 
 Based on this assessment, an action plan is made. In parallel, funding needs to be secured. 
 
 
 
 **3. Implementation**
 
 Local awareness-raising events and experiences create community buy-in for implementing clean, educate and transform activities. 
 
 
 
 **4. Monitoring & Evaluation**
 
 Careful monitoring and evaluation of pre-established output, outcome, and impact KPIs keep the implementation on track.
 
 
 
 **5. Celebrate**
 
 Every success, big or small, is celebrated. Local action, global impact.
 
 
 
 
 
 ## 5 main pillars of the Ripple Model
 
 
 
 ### 1. Awareness raising
 
 
 
 Generating awareness through a variety of activities and events, both at the local and the global level, is essential for three reasons:
 
 1. Enthusiasm/sense of urgency to act 
 
 2. Solution (provider) awareness (enable people to learn about River Cleanup and partners)
 
 3. A foundation for (local / river-level) system change (community buy-in is crucial for and through the implementation phase. 
 
 Local-level awareness raising is something any organization that likes to work with this Ripple Model can do. In addition, river Cleanup can handle national and global awareness raising.
 
 
 
 Examples of activities used (by River Cleanup) to raise awareness: River Cleanup Day, World Cleanup Day participation, River Cleanup World Challenge, company cleanups and inspiration sessions. 
 
 
 
 #### Impact onboarding
 
 
 
 We are continously looking for incentives to bring mobilize and reward our particpants. Optimism based tools can play a vital role in strenghtening our community and reporting impact on chain 
 
 
 
 [![PXL-20230709-093414766.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/26gxKDRL/PXL-20230709-093414766.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/TLqmKBPT)
 
 *Douala, Cameroon*
 
 
 
 ### 2. Assessment
 
 
 
 Effectively and efficiently making a river plastic-free requires a thorough understanding of the local context and root causes of plastic pollution in a river (section). Thorough doesn't mean time-consuming, but it needs to be done well. 
 
 
 
 That is why this Theory of Change and any intervention River Cleanup supports or undertakes within River Cleanup 2.0 starts with a holistic assessment of a river (section) and the surrounding areas that may contribute to or influence plastic leakage into the river. This assessment is the basis for a solid action plan, which is important to secure financing and gain/maintain local stakeholder support. 
 
 ‚ÄÉ
 
 
 
 #### Components of the assessment
 
 The assessment needs to be developed but is ideally a holistic (problem) assessment, looking at the problem and potential solutions from a legal, socio-economic, cultural, security, and environmental perspective. This includes:
 
 
 
 ‚Ä¢ Basic information: area, country, population, security situation, languages spoken etc. 
 
 
 
 ‚Ä¢ Problem assessment: main types of plastics, volume (legacy/new), sources of mismanaged plastics, pollution hotspots on land and in the river, points of leakage, socio-economic/cultural drivers, the negative consequences for people, animals, and the environment etc.
 
 
 
 ‚Ä¢ River parameters (length, source, rainfall, depth, tides, surface area, flood prove areas, tributaries etc.) 
 
 
 
 ‚Ä¢ Current interventions what has been done, when, locations, by whom, outcomes, reasons for success/failure etc.
 
 
 
 ‚Ä¢ Stakeholder analyses: who are the key stakeholders (polluters, decision-makers, local solution providers), what is their current role in the local plastics value chain, what is their potential to contribute to solutions etc.
 
 
 
 #### How to use the assessment
 
 The assessment, over time, can become an online do-it-yourself tool for (local) organizations worldwide, integrated into the River Cleanup website, and a paid service by River Cleanup for (local) governments and/or nonprofits who prefer to have the assessment professionally done. Example workflow:
 
 
 
 [![assessment-picture.png](https://i.postimg.cc/9M3GVB0r/assessment-picture.png)](https://postimg.cc/4K5KQVzg)
 
 
 
 
 
 ### 3. Clean
 
 
 
 Plastic-free rivers can only be achieved by cleaning up plastic historic (legacy) plastic leakage. The preventive collection contributes to avoiding leakage. Once sorted, plastics are ready to go into the circular economy. Emergency interventions (in case of flooding) are high impact, rapid collection of plastics/waste on land and rivers to contain and remove plastic leakage.
 
 
 
 Under clean, we distinguish five types of activities: 
 
 
 
 [![clean-picture.png](https://i.postimg.cc/ZY71c9MC/clean-picture.png)](https://postimg.cc/jCfgqjKb)
 
 
 
 These are the main KPIs to monitor progress and measure the results of clean activities towards the desired overall impact:
 
 
 
 [![clean-picture-kpi.png](https://i.postimg.cc/wT1nb6CF/clean-picture-kpi.png)](https://postimg.cc/zV1dy1XR)
 
 
 
 [![river-cleanup-albania.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/W1p0S3Ff/river-cleanup-albania.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/qzYtvpG8)
 
 *Albania*
 
 
 
 ### 4. Educate
 
 
 
 The clean pillar takes care of the legacy plastic pollution and creates a temporary plastic-free environment. The educate and transform pillar focus on permanent plastic-free rivers. Primary and secondary schools and universities play an essential role in making and keeping rivers plastic-free in the short, medium, and long term. The education pillar within the Ripple Model fulfills three critical functions:
 
 
 
 1. Gateway to communities 
 
 Schools and universities are often at the heart of local communities. In combination with their role as safe spaces for learning, schools and universities are ideal access points to a community.
 
 
 
 2. Direct impact & maximum lifetime impact (individual student)
 
 Through educational programs, children can immediately contribute to stopping leakage and start substituting, reducing, collecting, and reusing/recycling. Children have a lifetime of potential positive impact on plastic-free rivers ahead of them and are tomorrow's leaders and decision-makers.
 
 
 
 3. Direct impact & community support (community)
 
 A student generally has a network of at least 2 to 5 family and community members that can be reached via the student and school. Educational programs also provide a basis for community buy-in to sustain longer-term support for clean and transform activities.
 
 
 
 [![educate-picture.png](https://i.postimg.cc/fbSrB51L/educate-picture.png)](https://postimg.cc/1gPBz0mh)
 
 
 
 [![river-cleanup-activiating-kids.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/9MHM88gF/river-cleanup-activiating-kids.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/f35DkKh6)
 
 *Belgium*
 
 
 
 ### Transform
 
 
 
 People are the solution to plastic pollution in rivers. But for many people, this requires change. Transform translates as 'to change the form of something¬¥, and the positive connotation it usually has is carried forward in this pillar of the Ripple Model. 
 
 The transform pillar consists of two components that both deal with change but in different ways at different stages of the plastic life cycle. Structural change focuses on the part of the life cycle where plastics have not (yet) become waste. The circular economy component focuses on plastic waste once it has been sorted. 
 
 
 
 **Component 1: Structural change** 
 
 
 
 Inspiring & facilitating structural (behavior) change in people and organizations to maximize the substitution and reduction of (single use) plastics
 
 
 
 **Component 2: Circular economy**
 
 1. Collecting, sharing, and facilitating the implementation of existing and innovative circular economy solutions
 
 2. Processing sorted plastics
 
 
 
 *Structural change explained*
 
 
 
 This structural change component of the transform pillar of the Ripple Model focuses on activities to inspire & facilitate structural (behavior) change in people and organizations to maximize the substitution and reduction of (single use) plastics. 
 
 
 
 
 
 *Priorities*
 
 
 
 * For maximum impact, we focus primarily (but not only) on substitution/reduction of consumer single-use plastics (also in line with BtPW), as these are the most significant contributors to plastic river/ocean pollution. 
 
 * The primary target audience is the general public. 
 
 
 
 * Single-use plastics in company production processes are not a primary focus because this kind of substitution/reduction is often highly specific and requires a different approach from company to company. 
 
 
 
 *Circular economy explained*
 
 
 
 In the clean pillar, we focus on collecting and sorting plastics. 
 
 But what to do with these plastics once sorted? 
 
 Everyone working on the problem of plastic pollution faces that same question. Instead of answering this question ourselves, we share the results and insights.
 
  
 
 
 
 1. Maintain/prolong the use
 
 2. Reuse / redistribute
 
 3. Refurbish/remanufacture
 
 4. Mechanical recycling (washing/shredding)
 
 5. Chemical conversion
 
 6. Safe (leakage-free) disposal 
 
 7. Incineration (as a final last resort)
 
 Put differently, solutions to maintain and prolong the use of plastics in their original shape are preferred. If that's not possible, we look at reuse or redistribution options. If that's not possible, refurbishing, and remanufacturing options, etc. By maximizing each preferred solution, we ensure that the maximum percentages of plastics are processed in the best possible manner.
 
 
 
 [![Transform-picture.png](https://i.postimg.cc/8zXhjSKJ/Transform-picture.png)](https://postimg.cc/k28Vpkdq)
 
 
 
 ### General Impact KPIs
 
 
 
 Activities result in outputs, outcomes, and, eventually, these three desired impacts. Each impact KPI is subdivided into three performance levels. The lowest level, level one, corresponds with macro/micro plastic-free rivers (negligible amount). The intervention area can be a part of a river, e.g., 1 km, and does not have to be a whole river at once. Therefore, a river can vary in score depending on the section.
 
 
 
 [![impact-kpi.png](https://i.postimg.cc/WbbFryJM/impact-kpi.png)](https://postimg.cc/bdWwf3gJ)
 
 
 
 ### Contribution to SDGs
 
 
 
 Making rivers plastic-free directly contributes to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Breaking the Plastic Wave has quantified the System Change Scenario's contribution to nine SDGs. In addition, we have added SDG 17 to the Ripple Model because of the crucial role partnerships play in making rivers plastic-free. 
 
 
 
 [![Screenshot-2023-08-11-at-21-41-32.png](https://i.postimg.cc/W1Z2JmSG/Screenshot-2023-08-11-at-21-41-32.png)](https://postimg.cc/G4c0WyWt)

Title: Atlantis: Home to Changemakers
Description:
Atlantis founded in 2022, is a peer-to-peer impact network for builders, entrepreneurs and creators from the climate and social impact sector.
 
 
 
 # Introduction to Atlantis #
 
 
 
 We design and develop tools that help Changemakers implement, measure and manage the impact of their social and green enterprises/projects. 
 
 
 
 We recently launched our DAO coordination tool called the **Atlantis Citizen App** where community members can earn from bounties ü•≥
 
 
 
 We have also set in motion our venture service called **Atlantis Labs** with which we are able to support ReFi and climate projects in developing software and productizing their solutions. 
 
 
 
 Our current focus is Impact DAOs, NGOs and organisations that build climate solutions, decentralise science and tackle metacrisis. 
 
 
 
 ## What have we done since the last Gitcoin round? ##
 
 
 
 1. In the last three months, we kick-started Atlantis Labs; helping **Kula** develop the **Sacred Sanctuaries Network**. Helped with the launch of Regenbuild & Hyperchange.
 
 
 
 [![Atlantis-Lab-Live-Projects.png](https://i.postimg.cc/T1JtNWQb/Atlantis-Lab-Live-Projects.png)](https://postimg.cc/CndCz53M)
 
 
 
 2. Responsible for **GreenPill Network‚Äôs India Chapter**. So far have set up the core team comprising founders from a number of up-and-coming ReFi projects and other prominent ReFi and Gitcoin community contributors.
 
 
 
 3. Identified and commenced developing physical spaces called Sanctuaries with Kula. These sanctuaries will be part of the **Sacred Sanctuaries platform**
 
 
 
 [![image-2023-08-12-00-26-29.png](https://i.postimg.cc/HLYL8G89/image-2023-08-12-00-26-29.png)](https://postimg.cc/cvzWPbmv)
 
 
 
 4. Deployed another 600+ bounties using the Citizen App in Rural India (Chikamagaluru) as part of the pilot with **Mercy Corps Ventures**. So far we have deployed 1000+ bounties in this area. These bounties have helped gather feedback and insights in testing the app as we prepare for a global launch.
 
 
 
 5. Conducted in collaboration with **Solarpunk Nomads**, a series of workshops for co-designing the first Solarpunk vehicle in India with over 80+ attendees; including school kids.
 
 
 
 [![Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-11-31-AM.png](https://i.postimg.cc/FK2MS37g/Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-11-31-AM.png)](https://postimg.cc/B8B7985X)
 
 [![Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-13-27-AM.png](https://i.postimg.cc/G3Zj1K6j/Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-13-27-AM.png)](https://postimg.cc/8smvRRpF)
 
 
 
 ## Highlights from the past ##
 
 
 
 1. Created over 1000+ green jobs in the last year, with the majority of these jobs going to underserved communities and women from rural India.
 
 [![Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-14-10-AM.png](https://i.postimg.cc/tCBCxvy3/Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-14-10-AM.png)](https://postimg.cc/kBtmrc2G)
 
 2. Designed, engineered & launched the Atlantis Citizen App (Beta).
 
 3. Established decentralised water networks across 15 rural villages in India - located in Chikmagalur (in partnership with Mercy Corps Ventures).
 
 4. Organised and hosted the first-ever week-long GreenPill Festival in India for 100 regens.
 
 [![Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-14-54-AM.png](https://i.postimg.cc/Vk3wq3hC/Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-14-54-AM.png)](https://postimg.cc/pmY3x1RW)
 
 
 
 ## What is next for us? ##
 
 
 
 ### Upcoming Impact Partnerships ###
 
 
 
 
 
 **1. Sacred Sanctuaries - with Kula**
 
 
 
 Weaving and developing a network of physical spaces dedicated to learning and living the art of regeneration. With the sanctuaries and their programmes, our goal is to co-create a regenerative pathway that will inspire people to learn, apply and thrive with regenerative practices in the process, decarbonising and ushering in a cleaner, greener and more inclusive future. In order to improve coordination and knowledge sharing within the network we are developing a digital platform called Sacred Sanctuaries. The platform will help connect the efforts across bioregions. 
 
 
 
 **2. Rebuilding Turkey - with EarthistDAO + Anka Fund** 
 
 
 
 Helping on-ground organisations and NGOs to deploy and implement funds in a transparent manner across multiple rehabilitation and restoration projects. The partnership will involve using the Atlantis Citizen App to distribute the raised fund ($300,000) to numerous local organisations and carry out their impact work across various humanitarian initiatives
 
 
 
 **3. Public Goods Service - With Solarpunk Nomads**
 
 
 
 After the successful implementation of Phase 1, we will be entering Phase 2 of this collaboration with the Solarpunk Nomads where we will be moving the vehicle to Kumta.
 
 The vehicle will be deployed for local clean-up drives and climate awareness drives across schools and colleges.
 
 
 
 **4. Tree Planting - with Treegens**
 
 
 
 Mangrove planting along the coastlines of Western Ghats. We are currently working out permits that will allow the Treegen team to plant the trees. The entire operation will be captured on Atlantis Citizen App recording all the verifiable data points that will validate the on-ground efforts.
 
 
 
 **5. GreenPill India - with GreenPill Network**
 
 
 
 As the chapter lead for India, our focus will be on conducting a series of hackathons and in-person meetups where young Indian digital natives will be educated on the possibilities of public goods and regenerative cryptoeconomics. 
 
 
 
 ## Our Core Products and Services ##
 
 
 
 ### 1. Atlantis Citizen App ###
 
 
 
 ### A digital tool for community members to coordinate and create credible impact. ### 
 
 [![Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-16-37-AM.png](https://i.postimg.cc/wjNZp3W1/Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-16-37-AM.png)](https://postimg.cc/qNkjcBHr)
 
 
 
 **Benefits of Atlantis Citizen App**
 
 
 
 For Individuals:
 
 
 
 üå≥ Can earn from completing impact bounties.
 
 üå≥ Helps to coordinate and organize in groups to implement impact projects
 
 üå≥ Rewards for reducing individual footprint & for contributing to impact bounties
 
 üå≥ Create a credible social network graph backed by verified impact
 
 For Organisations:
 
 üå≥ 10X easier and affordable to set up on-ground impact projects
 
 üå≥ Provides a range of financing & PMEL features for deploying impact projects
 
 üå≥ Access to knowledge base and methodologies from experts
 
 üå≥ Coordinate between multiple stakeholders across multiple impact projects
 
 üå≥ Generate Impact Certificates for the bounties implemented using Atlantis Citizen App
 
 
 
 [![Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-17-40-AM.png](https://i.postimg.cc/3wBL8G2x/Screenshot-2023-08-12-at-12-17-40-AM.png)](https://postimg.cc/4KYvwm8D)
 
 ## Features of Atlantis Citizen App ##
 
 üå±Social Profile - A user‚Äôs social profile within Atlantis, is a compostable social identity layer which acts as a next-generation social capital opening up access and recognition across the internet and IRL.
 
 üå±Earn - Complete digital/physical climate bounties, earn in your favourite token/currency and pick up a whole lot of good karma along the way.
 
 üå±Oracle Maps - A location-based registry recording impact and vital eco data that broadens users‚Äô understanding/sense-making of climate and social impact change; helping them visualize the impact of climate action like never before.
 
 üå±Impact Certificates - Verified and Immutable proof of Impact for a Projects impact action. The Impact Certs provide real-time data with high contextual data which gives complete transparency on how the funds were deployed and the user‚Äôs actions.
 
 üå±Marketplace - Choose from a wide range of products/services from vetted green brands, curated specially for Atlantis users. The best part; you can use your earned Karma to unlock huge discounts.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 ### 2. Atlantis Labs: ###
 
 
 
 ### A Venture tech service for climate and ReFi projects. ###
 
 
 
 
 
 [![Changemakers-Grant.png](https://i.postimg.cc/15gSTmwd/Changemakers-Grant.png)](https://postimg.cc/GH16T1MP)
 
 We design and develop custom solutions that help our partners bring speed and scale to their efforts in tackling climate and social challenges. 
 
 
 
 Our deep experience in climate solutions and engineering help us offer a unique edge to climate and social impact projects. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 ## TEAM ##
 
 
 
 Atlantis was founded by two mechanical engineers, Irthu and Nakul, decade-long friends who spent the last 5 years building climate solutions.
 
 
 
 Their first venture, Hydrop, was a decentralised water network that served over 11,000 users in Bangalore. Bootstrapped and profitable, this helped them build out their bigger vision in the form of Atlantis.
 
 
 
 Irthu S is a Mechanical Engineer and Product Designer with 10 years XP in Startup Saas and Ecommerce built his first venture in climate tech in 2018.
 
 Nakul R is a Mechanical Engineer, specialised in leading Operations and Finance. Before joining Irthu, Nakul spent over 5 years in the Aeronautical and Healthcare sectors.
 
 
 
 In the last 5 years, both founders have accumulated vast experience building climate solutions on-ground across different terrains and geographies within India. Fast forward to today, there are over 12 core contributors and over 3000 community members across the world helping build Atlantis.
 
 
 
 [![asdasd.png](https://i.postimg.cc/wxmsppX1/asdasd.png)](https://postimg.cc/z3qfC4PN)
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 ## How does Atlantis contribute to Decentralised Commons and Public Goods? ##
 
 
 
 The Atlantis ecosystem consists of solutions both at a protocol level as well as an application level. Our products and services are geared towards amplifying the efforts of driven founders and builders in the social impact sector. As the name suggests, Atlantis is a home for changemakers and it is our mission to bring speed and scale to credible efforts on tackling climate and social injustice.

Title: TREEGENS - The Most Transparent & Rewarding Tree Planting
Description:
Treegens have funded and planted over 1 million mangrove trees since GR17! We are growing a movement of regenerators around the world through the most rewarding and transparent tree planting. Jimi Cohen personally set a new World Record for tree planting and the Treegen movement will break the record for most trees planted by any number of people in a 24 hour period, which is 350 million trees, set by Ethiopia.
 
 
 
 ![Jimi Planted 23,810 Mangrove Trees in 24 Hours](https://i.postimg.cc/4ysX3g0x/Tree-Planting-Champion.jpg)
 
 
 
 üå≥ **THE CHALLENGE**üå≥
 
 
 
 **Misaligned Incentives**
 
 Our economy currently values the degeneration of nature more than it values the regeneration of nature. Until it flips the other way, nature will continue to be degraded.
 
 
 
 **Impact Transparency**
 
 The impact sector faces criticism for not providing enough transparency. Donor updates are often reused, leading to lack of trust and reduced contributions overall.
 
 
 
 üå≥ **HOW WE WILL SOLVE IT** üå≥
 
 
 
 **Tokenized Trees**
 
 The $TREES token with Proof of Plant - only issued to those who prove that they have proven they have planted mangrove trees by filming the land before & after for our AI tree counter to assess. Treegen DAO members also validate the videos submitted, GPS coordinates & the Treegen planters to avoid double counting. These tokens are Eco Credits, which follow a set of biodiversity methodologies that not only prove that trees have successfully been planted but are also growing over the course of 3 years. 
 
 
 
 ![Nature Revalue](https://i.postimg.cc/T3zDkQCx/revalue-nature.png)
 
 
 
 **Non-Fungible Updates (NFU)**
 
 Every single tree planted by Treegens or funded for our For Trees Club partners to plant is counted with AI, with more than 97.5% accuracy. Videos with this AI tree counter overlaid are then brought on-chain as Non-Fungible Updates. Livepeer helps us scale this process. 
 
 
 
 ![AI Tree Counting Software](https://i.postimg.cc/nh6P5gDS/AI-Tree-Counter.webp)
 
 
 
 **Dynamic Semi-Soulbound Tokens (DSST)**
 
 Treegen NFTs dynamically display your impact metrics. The mind orbs & heart orbs get brighter according to how many trees you either fund or plant respectively, both verified with AI. While the underlying artwork is transferable, these overlaid orbs are non-transferable and will display on whichever Treegen NFT is connected to our DApp for your profile. This is because we are gamifying regeneration. 
 
 
 
 **Carbon Forwards - Rewarding Exponential Growth**
 
 We will be unlocking the full potential of carbon forwards as a catalyst for exponential regeneration while rewarding Treegens. 
 
 
 
 Carbon forwards are where impact investors buy the future value of carbon credits in the short term. Even though these forwards are sold at a reduced rate, they still equate to approximately 9X more than what it costs to plant the mangrove trees. This is after dedicating 50% for sustainability & conservation efforts and 10% towards rewarding Treegen holders. 1M mangrove trees is only 6 carbon forward deals away from funding over 500B mangrove trees under this model. 
 
 
 
 ![Exponential Regeneration](https://i.postimg.cc/PrhB4gjt/Untitled-design-28.png)
 
 
 
 üå≥**ACCOMPLISHMENTS SO FAR**üå≥
 
 
 
 **Development**
 
 ‚úÖ$TREES Token 
 
 ‚úÖWeb3 leaderboard to gamify trees funded & planted 
 
 ‚úÖNon-Fungible Updates 
 
 
 
 **Partnerships**
 
 ‚úÖ KYOTO Protocol is a layer 1 blockchain ecosystem for ReFi launching in September. They have already funded Treegens to plant 1M trees, which were planted in about 1 month. KYOTO had also expressed an interest in planting another 3M mangrove trees with us in September & supporting Treegens through potential marketing & grant funding.
 
 ‚úÖ Many NFT projects are leveraging the Treegens Non-Fungible Updates technology such as Ecosapiens, FightersGang, Greenstix, Crypto Whales, Forest Heroes & Mergulls.
 
 ‚úÖThrough our Bluesphere Carbon partnership, we have lined up impact investors for carbon forward deals so we can achieve our vision of exponential regeneration. 
 
 ‚úÖ Jimi Cohen is also the co-founder of For Trees Club, which oversees the tree planting that Treegens fundraises for and has developed the AI tree counting software used for non-fungible updates. 
 
 
 
 **Treegens Art**
 
 ‚úÖThe highly talented permaculture expert, prompting artist and designer TreeDjinn has spent many months creating the Treegen DSST artworks and designing the dynamic orbs. We have gotten substantial feedback from the community to co-create the ideal genesis DSSTs.
 
 
 
 ![Treegen Art](https://i.postimg.cc/mkB0Mtk9/Screen-Shot-2023-08-11-at-6-17-56-am.png)
 
 
 
 **Gamified Treegens Leaderboards**
 
 ‚úÖConfirms trees planted & trees funded on-chain
 
 ![Treegen Art](https://i.postimg.cc/gjQnjqS4/Screen-Shot-2023-08-11-at-5-51-47-am.png)
 
 
 
 **Community & Education**
 
 ‚ÄúMAX IMPACT has become a staple for the ReFi community‚Äù - Jon
 
 ‚úÖ335+ episodes to empower changemakers to maximise their positive impact by leveraging the latest & greatest technology
 
 ‚úÖTogether, For Trees Club & Treegens have trained 100+ tree planters on best practices across the coast of Kenya & Tanzania & this number is rapidly increasing
 
 ‚úÖFilmed educational videos on how to know when propagules are ready to be planted, how far apart they should be, where to plant, how to film the trees & how to upload the videos for our AI tree counter
 
 ‚úÖMAX IMPACT is being edited into a podcast with animated video highlights of the best tips for maximising positive impact from people like Gregory Landua of Regen Network, the Griffft of Giveth & Owocki from Gitcoin & Supermodular
 
 
 
 
 
 **Regeneration**
 
 ‚úÖFor Trees Club and Treegens have planted over 1,800,000 mangrove trees to date 
 
 
 
 Jimi also personally planted 1 tree per follower on all 3 Twitter of these pages multiple times:
 
 ‚úÖ @fortreesclub - 1450+
 
 ‚úÖ @thetreegens - 2000+
 
 ‚úÖ @jimicohen - 9250+
 
 
 
 üå≥ **WHAT WE ARE BUILDING** üå≥
 
 
 
 ‚û°Ô∏èOnline educational courses to onboard Regenerators in developing countries into Web3
 
 ‚û°Ô∏èDynamic Semi-Soulbound Tokens that integrate $TREES with a new ERC token standard
 
 
 
 **DApp platform**
 
 ‚û°Ô∏èDAO validators for Proof of Plant. 50% of the Treegens mint goes towards the DAO treasury to support impactful projects the DAO votes on. The other 50% of our NFT mint directly funds mangrove tree planting.
 
 ‚û°Ô∏èOptimal UI / UX for our platform including an interactive globe with all Non-Fungible Updates displayed. Below is an example from our recent 1M trees with For Trees Club: 
 
 
 
 ![Map](https://i.postimg.cc/BbGTb3jX/Screen-Shot-2023-08-11-at-5-39-53-am.png)
 
 
 
 üå≥ **TEAM** üå≥
 
 
 
 ![Team](https://i.postimg.cc/rwz8drXt/Blue-Professional-Team-Organization-Graph.png)

Title: Bloom Network
Description:
# üåç A cyber-physical social network that helps people find and participate in grassroots climate actions where they live. https://bloomnetwork.earth
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 More people want to join than we can keep up with with current resources - we need your support!
 
 
 
 
 
 Bloom Network is 30,000 people on the ground in 32 local Bloom hubs across 9 countries. Local Bloom hubs plant community gardens, teach people to form agroforestry and solar co-ops, and build regional regenerative economies. Online through Bloom‚Äôs social network, we share knowledge peer-to-peer to implement climate repair more quickly and cost-effectively.
 
 
 
 
 
 We just completed our smart contracts for regenerative action rewards! More info below.
 
 
 
 
 
 # Local Impact Example
 
 
 
 
 
 Broadfield Enterprises Uganda has catalyzed 1300 smallholder farmers in Sanje to successfully implement commercial permaculture. Community members plant permaculture agroforestry gardens with 3 export crops and 500 indigenous plant species. Their method results in transformational development of good soils, microclimate, and increased canopy cover. The farms establish local food and economic security, reduced waste and female-led cooperatives. Seven schools with 70,000+ pupils are learning permaculture through their curriculum, and they are scaling to another 100,000+ pupils. They recently formed a Permaculture Innovation Hub in partnership with Bloom and Africa First to support and educate local farmers with social entrepreneurship skills! By collaborating with Bloom Network, they are able to increase the global distribution of their coffee, find more business mentors, and augment their finance. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 üåø Here is a video featuring their crew and describing Bloom‚Äôs Impact Bounties program. https://youtu.be/ZfB99leZ1Uo 
 
 
 
 Bloom Network is well positioned to onboard millions of new users to web3 in the coming years. Our full-featured social network helps people build permanent relationships of mutual support, and makes existing low-cost solutions more visible and replicable.
 
 
 
 [![Impact Bounties Pilot](https://i.postimg.cc/XNtrpg08/youtube.png)](https://postimg.cc/XXcjPdqG)
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 # Achievements since Gitcoin Beta Round, with $5500
 
 
 
 
 
 Completed our smart contracts for our Regenerative Action bounties protocol with Inverter Network.
 
 - RoleBasedAuthorizer: https://github.com/InverterNetwork/inverter-contracts/tree/276-roleAuthorizer
 
 - BountyManager: https://github.com/InverterNetwork/inverter-contracts/blob/277-bountymanager-logicmodule/src/modules/logicModule/BountyManager.sol 
 
 [![Bloom Open Bounty Workflow](https://i.postimg.cc/RZ4VHspc/649466d6bb13b86d85a7ffba-Screenshot-2023-06-22-at-18-20-40-1.png)](https://postimg.cc/mtpsxwsD)
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Welcomed 9 new Local Bloom hubs. We are thrilled to report that the most common comment we receive when onboarding people is ‚ÄúOMG, this is IT!‚Äù. We designed the platform with and by local community organizers around the world, to address what they were missing from mainstream social media for effective global collaboration.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Coded new features: 
 
 - [Editable Local Bloom Pages](https://bloomnetwork.earth/diamante)
 
 - [Member Products and Services Directory](https://bloomnetwork.earth/communityofferings)
 
 - Recommended blogs under posts
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 ## Q4 Budget Needs
 
 - $4,500 - digital community lead: onboard new members
 
 - $4,000 - mid-senior developer: performance optimization, social wallet login, contracts integration
 
 - $2,000 - [Magenta Ceiba](https://www.linkedin.com/in/magentaceiba/): design and build an introductions system for members to make magic together
 
 - $5,000 - [Inverter Network](https://www.inverter.network/): smart contracts completed in Q3
 
 - $2,800 - Brainfog: final payment due for their work building the core of Bloom social network in 2022
 
  - Gratis - Grantwriting team working on securing funds for our food system work on the ground
 
 
 
 Total: $18,300
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 **Funds received above this amount will go into the Regenerative Action Rewards pool to reward members for reporting their local impacts.**
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 # üôåüèΩ Our Protocol Team 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Bloom International members build technology for major television networks and DAO governance, and are professional journalists and creatives. Want to join our team? Here‚Äôs some [open roles](https://bloomnetwork.earth/engage/contribute)! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Team: [Magenta Ceiba](https://www.linkedin.com/in/magentaceiba/), [Meg Rivers](https://www.linkedin.com/in/meg-rivers-9bb464159/), [Aishwarya Iyer](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aishwarya-iyer-1727b682/), [Manasa Shastri](https://www.linkedin.com/in/manasa-suresh-shastri/), [Anita Caldera](https://www.linkedin.com/in/anamaria-caldera-bba76bbb/), and 50+ local community organizers
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [![bloom-Roadmap.png](https://i.postimg.cc/mr4Z7ddY/bloom-Roadmap.png)](https://postimg.cc/FYPQ4xXz)

Title: Earthist - Decentralize the Seeds
Description:
Earthist Network is a mission-driven project initiated in 2019, focusing on preserving heirloom seeds and promoting regenerative hemp farming. We combine natural farming with modern technology, aiming to create micro-processing centers for small and family hemp farmers, further bolstering regional economies and seed preservation efforts.
 
 
 
 *Our aim and impact:*
 
 
 
 **Seed Sovereignty** 
 
 Decentralize seed preservation, ensuring seeds are adaptable to local conditions, and empowering communities to take charge of their agricultural future.
 
 **Boost Regional Economies** 
 
 Through the establishment of micro-processing centers, small and family hemp farmers get resources and knowledge to process their produce, ensuring better profitability and lesser carbon emissions.
 
 **Promote Regeneration** 
 
 With an emphasis on hemp's environmental benefits and regenerative processing and packaging methods, our network advocates for eco-friendly agricultural practices and supports other initiatives
 
 **Educate and Engage**
 
 The project also strives to raise awareness about seed diversity's significance, hemp's potential, and the importance of regeneration.
 
 **DAO Operator Program**
 
 We have initiated the "DAO Operator Program" with BanklessDAO_TR to empower individuals to engage with decentralized organizations, complete tasks, and earn token payments. This program is designed to not only offer immediate opportunities but also to equip participants with the skills and experience needed to thrive in global DAOs.
 
 
 
 
 
 ### Aiming for Impact
 
 Earthist Network's project is about more than just agriculture; it's a movement towards a regenerative, and community-centric future. 
 
 We aim for a future where seeds remain accessible and diverse, protecting our planet's agricultural heritage and ensuring a regenerative food system for generations to come.
 
 
 
 **Significance of Seed Diversity**
 
 In the contemporary agricultural landscape, 75% of plant genetic diversity has been lost since the 1900s. Astonishingly, out of around 30,000 edible plant species globally, only 150 are cultivated, and a mere 30 provide the majority of our diets. Such a narrow focus on crop cultivation increases vulnerability to diseases, pests, and changing climate conditions, threatening global food security.
 
 **Decentralizing Seed Preservation**
 
 Centralized seed banks, although essential, are vulnerable to natural and political disruptions. The Earthist vision of decentralized seed banks disperses the responsibility of seed conservation. Utilizing blockchain technology, the initiative ensures traceability, authenticity, and security of seed data. The goal is not just to preserve seeds, but to make them accessible and adaptable to varied local conditions.
 
 
 
 **Rediscovering Heirloom Seeds**
 
 In 2019, we embarked on a mission to rediscover lost local heirloom seeds and created our first seed bank in 2022
 
 
 
 **The Role of Hemp**
 
 Hemp, often misjudged due to its association with cannabis, is a primary focus of Earthist endeavors. It grows rapidly, has myriad uses from textiles to medicine, and offers environmental benefits, including carbon sequestration.
 
 
 
 Our engagement with heirloom seeds involves a comprehensive chain of activities:
 
 Planting
 
 Harvesting
 
 Seed Collection
 
 Processing & Packaging
 
 
 
 
 
 You can find more information at https://earthist.gitbook.io/earthist

Title: Kokonut Network; Building an Eco-Friendly Perpetual Asset
Description:
***Wouldn‚Äôt it be nice to create a perpetual protocol backed by natural assets unrelated to the crypto market, and eco-friendly and regenerative?***
 
 
 
 ### Personal Introduction
 
 
 
 I‚Äôm [**Wasabi**](https://link3.to/wasabinetwork), founder at [**Kokonut Network**](https://kokonut.network/). We are building a bridge to connect web3 and agriculture. We are creating a blockchain-based cooperative to develop and manage a network of coconut farms.
 
 
 
 Our main goal is to address the worldwide lack of funding for agricultural projects. We help farmers get the funds they need while creating opportunities for web3 communities by giving them access to perpetual natural assets.
 
 
 
 ### TL;DR
 
 
 
 Kokonut Network offers blockchain governance and open-source accounting services to the agricultural sector. Our mission is to encourage, organize, finance, and oversee coconut farms. We gather funds from the community using the Kokonut DAO framework to make decisions and distribute treasury funds.
 
 
 
 Kokonut Network can forge a lifelong partnership with its members through the Kokonut DAO, utilizing a combination of Agriculture, Blockchain, Web3, Soil, and Weather. This synergy has no expiration date, mirroring the fact that coconut trees are replanted when they cease to bear fruit.
 
 
 
 ### Table of Contents
 
 1. What‚Äôs Coming Next in Kokonut Network Q3 & Q4 2023 üîú
 
 2. This is what you‚Äôre helping bring to life üå±
 
 3. Major Updates since Beta Round **(April 2023 to August 2023)** ü§ñ
 
 4. Why Kokonut Network? ü••
 
 5. As Seen On
 
 6. Resources üß∞
 
 
 
 ## What's Coming Next in Kokonut Network Q3 & Q4 2023
 
 
 
 - Kokonut Network Green Paper (with **Expert's advice** from the [**Department of Agriculture**](https://agricultura.gob.do/))
 
 - Kokonut DAO has been selected to be included in [**Season 2**](https://cryptogood.substack.com/p/how-we-selected-15-impact-daos-to) of the **Impact DAO Book**
 
 - Kokonut DAO Constitution
 
 - Our first ever Public Ask Me Anything **([Link to the Event](https://link3.to/e/RJ233C))**
 
 - Kokonut V1 in Numbers **(Interactive Data Dashboard)**
 
 - New website page called **‚ÄúImpact‚Äù**
 
 - Research Paper ‚ÄúHow to regenerate your treasury with coconuts‚Äù [**Sneak Peek**](https://forum.metacartel.org/t/proposal-metacartel-treasury-sustainability/2277/11?u=kokonutnetwork)
 
 - Simplified & Streamlined [**Roadmap for 2023 & 2024**](https://link.kokonut.network/roadmap)
 
 
 
 ## This is what you're helping bring to life
 
 
 
 ### Kokonut Five Dimensions of Impact
 
 1. **WHAT** ‚Äì The objective is to test our DAO thesis by building and developing a coconut plantation under the DAO model, which intersects real-life communities, web3 communities, and global culture. The outcome of this investment will create a perpetual asset that will improve people's lives in every aspect.
 
 2. **WHO** ‚Äì The families who own the land where the project will be developed are underserved in every aspect, including education, finances, health, and opportunities. In Latin America, jobs and the economy mainly function in big cities, and the countryside is typically marginalized or taken advantage of by large corporations. A blockchain-based co-op can help remove many of these barriers.
 
 3. **HOW MUCH** ‚Äì Approximately 60 families own the land, and the project will create 1,000 direct and indirect jobs. This will be life-changing for everyone involved, as it will provide opportunities and value for at least 20 years.
 
 4. **CONTRIBUTION** ‚Äì Underserved individuals depend on these types of projects and new concepts based on blockchain that open doors to new paradigms and possibilities. The current system's criteria and entry-level are very high, making it difficult for those who cannot meet their standards.
 
 5. **RISK** ‚Äì We have several fail safes in place, such as agricultural insurance, open-source cloud accounting systems, government and community oversight, and technical support from all government agencies involved in the project framework.
 
 
 
 ### We asked ChatGPT "benefits of owning a Coconut Plantation"
 
 ![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BkVQSSV32.jpg)
 
 
 
 
 
 # Major Updates since Beta Round
 
 
 
 ### **DAO Framework Upgrade**
 
 
 
 Fractional ownership of Coconut Trees is coming to Kokonut DAO, now shares are ERC-20 allowing members to surpass the actual limitation of whole shares. This lowers the barrier to joining the DAO and further improves decentralization. 
 
 
 
 You can basically own a 1/2 of a Coconut Tree üå¥, learn more about DAOHaus V3 [**here**](https://daohaus.mirror.xyz/bcJCN2H7vow6xRE977A4pTWUNR0vqrgTscFLtu2ttn8).
 
 
 
 ### **Kokonut Podcast Deep Dive Sessions**
 
 
 
 Community-oriented podcast with the goal of highlighting Real World projects, learn more [**here**](https://paragraph.xyz/@kokonut/podcast-deep-dive-sessions)
 
 
 
 [**Kokonut Impact Dive #001**](https://link3.to/e/LX7RVL) Listen to the Twitter Space [**here**](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1dRKZMLazbbxB)
 
 [**Kokonut Impact Dive #002**](https://link3.to/e/Er24sl) Listen to the Twitter Space [**here**](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1eaKbrnVjreKX)
 
 
 
 
 
 ### **Social Media Content**
 
 
 
 As we keep working to establish our **Presence** in the Web3 community, we have been featured in multiple high-level publications and outlets, a [**Case Study**](https://www.charmverse.io/post/impact-dao-established-around-coconuts) by Charmverse based on the **Impact Nature of our DAO** and the community approach we are developing. We made into [**ReFi 101**](https://coincentral.com/regenerative-finance-101/) by EcoSapiens and got listed in many top DAOs directories like [**DeepDAO**](https://deepdao.io/organization/f0b9cb9b-da29-4035-8b05-2c8e8c33e7c1/organization_data/finance), [**DAOHQ**](https://www.daohq.co/daos/kokonut-network), [**DAOCentral**](https://daocentral.com/dao/kokonutdao), [**Decentra-List**](https://www.decentra-list.com/list-of-daos?search=kokonut), [**DAOs on Gnosis**](https://www.daosongnosis.com/) and [**The Pass**](https://www.thepass.to/dao/KokonutDAO/DAOPage).
 
 
 
 We have also participated in many Podcasts and Twitter Spaces like Crypto Altruism [**Episode 80**](https://www.cryptoaltruism.org/blog/crypto-altruism-podcast-episode80-kokonut-network-bridging-web3-and-sustainable-agriculture) "**Kokonut Network ‚Äì Bridging web3 and sustainable agriculture**", [**Twitter Space**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OnjA59F3fl4) with Charmverse talking about DAO Tooling, [**Unscheduled Twitter Space**](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1yoKMZQvLVeGQ?s=20) that turned out to be really interesting and gave us an extra boost in the **Impact DAO Ecosystem** and a [**Featured Episode**](https://www.buzzsprout.com/2057401/11847815) in All About Impact DAOs Podcast, The Planetary Pitch by Avano [**Launch Episode**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pAFkXtqn8ZQ), and [**Atlantis Climate Radio**](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1LyxBqDyQoYJN), just to name a few.
 
 
 
 **Latest community generated articles, blog posts & newsletters**
 
 * [**Topl Spotlight #13: Impactful Agriculture & DAOs With Kokonut Network‚Äôs Wasabi**](https://medium.com/topl-blog/topl-spotlight-13-impactful-agriculture-daos-with-kokonut-networks-wasabi-4b50f259bfe1)
 
 * The [@IMPACTOPIAearth's](https://twitter.com/IMPACTOPIAearth) [**#Impactzone Space**](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1rmGPkkLRpbKN?s=20) with [@KokonutNetwork](https://twitter.com/KokonutNetwork) was amazing! by [Sinouhe Monteiro](https://twitter.com/sinomont/status/1679773913390235649?s=20)
 
 * Twitter Spaces "[**ReFi Apoyando a LatAm**](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1MnxnppVAzBGO?s=20)" by [KOKO DAO](https://twitter.com/kokodaoxyz)
 
 
 
 
 
 ### New Partnerships
 
 - [**Glo Dollar**](https://twitter.com/glodollar/status/1689315371692539904?s=20)
 
 - [**HackOnChain**](https://twitter.com/hackonchain/status/1658851119454474244?s=20)
 
 
 
 ***These updates date range from April 2023 to August 2023***
 
 
 
 ---
 
 # Why Kokonut Network?
 
 
 
 In essence, Kokonut Network serves as the coordination layer that harnesses the power of web3 and open-source technologies to craft an adaptable organism capable of limitless expansion, thanks to its modular plug-and-play design framework.
 
 
 
 Every component of our network is crafted in alignment with our core values: community first, work and access freedom, and respect for diverse opinions.
 
 
 
 Our commitment extends to safeguarding the interests of minorities through a comprehensive approach. Our approach is different, as evidenced by our roadmap.
 
 
 
 [**Kokonut Network Diagram Swinlane Chart**](https://link.kokonut.network/diagram)
 
 
 
 ### Why coconuts? 
 
 #### Zero Waste Circular By Default Crop ‚ôªÔ∏è
 
 
 
 Coconut is the most cultivated and vital palm tree in the world, as it is the main source of vegetable fat. It is one of the plants that provide a wide variety of products and by-products, serving as a primary source of food, drinks, and shelter for animals.
 
 
 
 The coconut products market size was valued at $11.5 billion in 2018 and is estimated to reach $31.1 billion by 2026, registering a CAGR of 13.6% from 2019 to 2026. In 2018, the coconut oil segment accounted for more than half of the total coconut products market share.
 
 
 
 Coconut is a versatile fruit with many health benefits. Its derivatives, such as coconut oil, water, milk, desiccated coconut, coir, and copra, are used in the food, beverage, cosmetic, and personal care industries.
 
 
 
 ### Kokonut V1 [Production Layer üë®üèΩ‚Äçüåæ]
 
 
 
 Our first plantation will yield 18 million coconuts annually, enabling us to generate multiple revenue streams in the food, health, and automotive industries.
 
 
 
 **Learn more:** *<https://kokonut.network/kokonut-v1>*
 
 
 
 ### **Kokonut DAO** [Governance Layer üó≥Ô∏è]
 
 
 
 ***The DAO is the core vehicle for all fundraising, rewards distributions, and governance decisions.***
 
 
 
 Kokonut Network is a platform built by and for people. At its core, Kokonut DAO seeks to empower anyone who adds value to the Kokonut Network ecosystem, regardless of their social status or prior accomplishments.
 
 
 
 **Learn more:** *<https://kokonut.network/dao>*
 
 
 
 ### **Our Vision**
 
 
 
 Kokonut Network was created to reduce the obstacles to agricultural development, and rural project funding, and democratize investment in real-world projects. We will use blockchain technology to establish multiple plantations across the country, providing advantages to the global crypto communities and everyone in the network.
 
 
 
 ### **What makes us different?**
 
 
 
 Kokonut Network has a distinct approach. Rather than establishing our proposal or business plan by taking advantage of our users, and attempting to get them to purchase some non-backed token, we have created a resilient system over time. It is backed by coconut plants on our land and has a DAO for governance, funds allocation, and rewards sharing.
 
 
 
 **Learn more:** *<https://kokonut.network/about>*
 
 
 
 ## **‚ÄúAs Seen On‚Äù**
 
 Complete Database of Public Speaking, Podcasts, Newsletters Interviews [**here**](https://link.kokonut.network/press).
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 ## **Resources**
 
 
 
 - Website *<https://www.kokonut.network/>*
 
 - Let‚Äôs have a chat at *<https://link.kokonut.network/meeting>*
 
 - Join our Discord *<https://link.kokonut.network/discord>*
 
 - Kokonut Web3 Blog *<https://paragraph.xyz/@kokonut>*

 ***Thank you for reading this far. Follow our journey on Twitter [@KokonutNetwork](https://twitter.com/KokonutNetwork)***

Title: FORK FOREST
Description:
WHAT IS FORK FOREST?
 
 
 
 It is a ReFi initiative created late 2022 by members of Fork DAO¬π. It was immediately embraced by the community and helped the DAO's growth. Though it acts a separate entity, there is love and collaboration. An active presence of the community can be seen in the sold out NFT collection for the first project, the ReFi topic in the DAO's Telegram group and the weekly Twitter/X Spaces in the DAO's account, therefore creating ReFi content in spanish. Fork Forest is currently collaborating with other ReFi projects such as Ekonavi and GainForest.
 
 
 
 FORK FOREST 01
 
 
 
 The first project FORK FOREST 01 was assembled in January 2023 and successfully completed in May¬≤. We supported a local organisation called 'Zapam Zucum' by providing means of financiation and tools to link them with the community. We set up an NFT collection¬≥ and sold out. 100% of the money received at our first NFT campaign was directly dripped to 'Zapam Zucum'. We also onboarded 'Zapam Zupum' successfully‚Å¥, so they could open a hot wallet and use the funds without depending on anyone else. Thanks to all the efforts, we succesfully planted 50 native trees in an open reunion with the community and even members of the DAO travelling to be part. Works of ecological conservation were part of the job. It all ended with a festival with local bands at sunset.
 
 
 
 FORK FOREST 02
 
 
 
 For this second project, we are addressing an important problem in Argentina: improper use of agrochemicals. We are addressing the same region as the first project‚Åµ, bonding strongly with the local community.
 
 
 
 The region is the Traslasierras Valley in the province of Cordoba, in Argentina. We are working with an Agricultural Engineer who's a High school teacher in a small town called Los Cerrilos. We met Ing. Fernando Parra in our first project, since we purchased native trees from his production. This town is suffering the consequences of the poor use of agrochemicals, and we intend to help.
 
 
 
 The project is a 10km¬≤ forestal curtain mainly composed by native trees. Helped by the tools of GainForest, we can also measure all the benefits that a native forest brings to the world, and put value in a formerly forgotten area. 
 
 
 
 We are aiming to cover the first of the three stages, the first of three stages of the forestal curtain. This will take place in mid september in a collaboration with the commune of Los Cerrillos‚Å∂ and with the presence and support of INTA‚Å∑ (Argentina's National Institute of Agricultural Technology). Detailed info is in the budget‚Å∏.
